image.altText: Rupert Murdoch sitting on a couch with a young boy and a blonde woman

props.synopsis: Lachlan Murdoch was once the reluctant heir apparent to a sprawling media empire, spending years in the wilderness after a confrontation with his father. This is how he was welcomed back into the fold and handed the keys to the kingdom.

title.children: As the eldest boy, Lachlan Murdoch has won the chance to rule the empire — unless his siblings stop him

image.altText: Two police officers sit side by side. Their faces are cut out.

props.synopsis: The 30-year-old officer is charged with sexual intercourse without consent, choking, strangling or suffocating in a domestic relationship and aggravated assault.

title.children: NT police officer charged with rape, choking and aggravated assault

image.altText: A composite image of six women smiling

props.synopsis: Sandra Sully says she once called out the behaviour of a former male colleague after hearing him say a particular journalist's breasts were too large for her role on camera.

title.children: 'Still a boys' club': Female TV journalists on the things that still need to change

image.altText: Lachie Neale smiles and pumps his fist towards the crowd as he leads the Lions off the Gabba

props.synopsis: The grand final awaits the Brisbane Lions after a preliminary final victory over Carlton that was inspired by an unheralded young defender and a unique star recruit. Here are five quick hits.

title.children: Five quick hits — An unlikely hero ignites the Lions as a superstar Blue produces another finals misfire

image.altText: An NRL player with his fists raised in the air in triumph, smiling to a packed grandstand

props.synopsis: Reece Walsh had his magician's cloak on Saturday night, treating the biggest-ever NRL crowd at Lang Park to a special show that was so impressive the officials missed a blatant forward pass. Here are the five quick hits from the Broncos' victory over the Warriors.

title.children: Five quick hits —  A forward pass can't disguise Reece Walsh's playful magnicificence as Broncos reach the grand final

image.altText: A view of bright green coral with fish and sharks in the background.

props.synopsis: For some, the name "Bikini Bottom" will be synonymous with a pineapple under the sea — the fictional home of SpongeBob SquarePants. But the underwater world of the quirky cartoon character is based on a real place in the Pacific Ocean — and one with a dark history.

title.children: Why nuclear researchers are drawn to the underwater 'home' of SpongeBob SquarePants

image.altText: Four polaroid pictures of people with different disabilities in front of a purple background

props.synopsis: As the disability royal commission prepares to hand down its final report, the community has its hopes pinned on recommendations to put an end to the trauma so many still experience, writes Nas Campanella.

title.children: Without change, the trauma of the disability royal commission will have all been for nothing

image.altText: Thao Tran looking at the camera with tattoos.

props.synopsis: In most Asian cultures, tattoos are viewed as a symbol of gang activity, violence or criminal behaviour. As a result, many children choose to hide their tattoos to avoid conflict with their parents.

title.children: Thao Tran's mum told her that if she ever got a tattoo, she would scrape it off her

image.altText: A man in suit speaks at UN.

props.synopsis: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov says Ukraine's proposed peace plan is "not realistic" and accuses the West of direct fighting in Ukraine during his UN speech, as another missile attack hits the city of Sevastopol in Crimea.

title.children: Sergei Lavrov dismisses Ukraine's peace plan and rails against the West, as another missile attack hits Crimea

image.altText: Manal Rostom, wearing white headscrarf, colourful jacket, stands with crossed arms against plan wall smiling with mouth closed.

props.synopsis: For those who follow Islam, wearing a hijab is prescribed for women from puberty. But some women have complicated relationships with the head covering.

title.children: 'It's a way of life': These Muslim women share their perspectives on wearing the hijab

image.altText: A blonde woman sitting at a piano with a young child on her lap who is pressing the keys

props.synopsis: There's a certain subject at school that is music to the ears of its students and the outcomes speak for themselves. Now, finally, teachers are being recognised for the role they play in the lives of music-loving children.

title.children: Teachers have their own category at an awards show and it's about time

image.altText: A man and woman smile for the camera.

props.synopsis: The Korumburra pastor had been taken to Austin Hospital in a critical condition following a family lunch where police suspect he ingested death cap mushrooms.

title.children: Suspected mushroom poisoning victim Ian Wilkinson released from hospital after 'significant progress'

image.altText: Xi Jinping shaking hands with Xanana Gusmao in front of Chinese flags.

props.synopsis: The agreement was made ahead of the opening ceremony of the Asian Games in Hangzhou.

title.children: 'Strengthen international cooperation': China and Timor Leste make deal to form strategic partnership

image.altText: Justin Trudeau rises to make a statement in the House of Commons.

props.synopsis: The US ambassador has confirmed that Justin Trudeau was informed of the possible involvement of Indian agents in the killing of a Sikh leader.

title.children: Five Eyes intelligence informed Canada's PM of India's possible involvement in Sikh leader's murder

image.altText: the former premier of new south wales gladys berejiklian stands outdoors behind microphones speaking to the media

props.synopsis: In June, the corruption watchdog found Ms Berejiklian had engaged in serious corrupt conduct. At the time her supporters criticised the decision, urging her to appeal.

title.children: Former NSW premier Gladys Berejiklian takes legal action against the ICAC

image.altText: People take part in a rally against the voice to parliament in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people attend unofficial No vote rallies across Australia ahead of the Voice to Parliament referendum on October 14.

title.children: Protesters gather in major cities, calling for No vote in Voice referendum

image.altText: A mother with blonde hair sits next to her dog and daughter, who is reading a book

props.synopsis: Homeless people are threatened with fines and even jail time as councils crack down on those forced to sleep in car parks amid a nationwide housing crisis.

title.children: 'Where do they want us to go?': Councils crack down on car sleepers at peak of homelessness crisis

image.altText: A Regional Express aeroplane on tarmac.

props.synopsis: Sydney-based specialist who regularly travel to outreach clinics in regional areas say they’re concerned the airline’s decision to reduce flights will put further strain on access specialist care.

title.children: Rex Airlines route cuts spark fears for regional health services

image.altText: Rupert smiles as he walks alongside Rebekah.

props.synopsis: With a career spanning 70 years, Rupert Murdoch is no stranger to facing the same kind of interviewing and investigative treatment that he has dished out in his media outlets.

title.children: 'I'm rather sick of snobs': In 1971, Murdoch gave Four Corners a no-holds-barred interview about his empire

image.altText: A man looks at the camera, with his hands raised and palms facing the camera

props.synopsis: Russell Brand has spent years standing in the space between conspiracy theories and wellness online — this is why he wants you there with him.

title.children: Russell Brand speaks for first time amid sexual assault claims — and his choice of platform is revealing

image.altText: Blacklisted Research

props.synopsis: An obscure 1980s documentary about the Indigenous land rights movement has become a clarion call for those opposing the Voice to Parliament. An ABC Investigations analysis has traced how a debunked conspiracy theory about communists was weaponised to divide voters on the referendum.

title.children: White supremacists are using an obscure 40-year-old documentary to split the Voice vote

image.altText: A man typing on a computer with multiple screens curved around him

props.synopsis: He's just "a dude on the web", but Troy Hunt has ended up playing an oddly central role in global cybersecurity.

title.children: Why the FBI calls this Gold Coast man when it finds a trove of stolen data

image.altText: A swarm of red fire ants.

props.synopsis: Fire ants are a real pain. Their name is based on what it feels like to be stung by one — but it is far from the biggest pain in the insect world.

title.children: What's Australia's worst insect stinger? Hint: it's not the dreaded fire ant

image.altText: Emerald Lake in Canada.

props.synopsis: Plenty of young Australians are living the dream of working abroad but many struggle to find a safe place to live or a job that pays the bills, particularly in busy tourist hotspots like Banff or London.

title.children: It's known best for picture-perfect views but Canada's Rockies hide a dire housing crisis

image.altText: A solar system installer adjusts solar panels on the roof of a house.

props.synopsis: The rise of rooftop solar in Australia shows no signs of slowing, bringing cheap, clean power. But the technology is also reshaping the power system in some surprising ways.

title.children: Generators pay to stay on as dominant rooftop solar 'cannibalises' electricity prices

image.altText: an orange map with faces of northern territory people popping out

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has the highest proportion of Indigenous people out of all the states and territories. This is what they think of the Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: This is what Indigenous Australians in remote NT communities think of the Voice

image.altText: Sogavare speaking at UN

props.synopsis: Solomon Islands Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare has declined a White House invitation to meet with US President Joe Biden at next week's Pacific leaders' summit.

title.children: Solomon Islands PM snubs meeting with Biden, praises China's 'global security initiative'

image.altText: Adelaide Crows AFLw players celebrate a goal against GWS.

props.synopsis: Adelaide encounters minimal trouble as it posts a dominant 69-point win over GWS at Canberra's Manuka Oval.

title.children: Crows thrash Giants to continue hot start to AFLW season, wins for Tigers, Cats
